word:
Christ took not on him the nature of angels, but the nature of man, that he might acquaint himself with the temptations with which he was beset, and help man in his fallen state, and by his own humiliation and death elevate men to become heirs with him to his Father's kingdom. Christ endured the strongest temptations of Satan, that he might experience in himself 
                                                                           150
the severest conflict which the children of men would have with the fallen foe, and that he might sustain those who should come to him for strength in their temptations.
